pr_title: Support multitenancy with multiple persistence units

timeline.bodyText: @michael-schnell @Sanne I'm not entirely sure this is useful now that we can define a datasource for a PU. Or in the case of the schema do you want to use another datasource when the tenant is defined?
timeline.author: gsmet
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -149,16 +149,40 @@
     @ConfigItem(defaultValue = "true")
     public boolean secondLevelCachingEnabled;
 
+    /**
+     * Defines the method for multi-tenancy (DATABASE, NONE, SCHEMA). The complete list of allowed values is available in the
+     * https://docs.jboss.org/hibernate/stable/orm/javadocs/org/hibernate/MultiTenancyStrategy.html[Hibernate ORM JavaDoc].
+     * The type DISCRIMINATOR is currently not supported. The default value is NONE (no multi-tenancy).
+     *
+     * @asciidoclet
+     */
+    @ConfigItem
+    public Optional<String> multitenant;
+
+    /**
+     * Defines the name of the datasource to use in case of SCHEMA approach. The datasource of the persistence unit will be used
+     * if not set.
+     */
+    @ConfigItem
+    public Optional<String> multitenantSchemaDatasource;

replies.bodyText: AFAICT there is actually zero difference between SCHEMA and DATABASE in Hibernate multitenancy, so I don't think you need two things.
replies.author: gavinking

replies.bodyText:
I don't know about Hibernate ORM but it makes a difference here as things are handled in the Quarkus extension. I'm unclear though if we really want this.
I agree this needs more discussions and thoughts.
replies.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: There might not be a difference within Hibernatate between SCHEMA and DATABASE, but there is one if you need to generate to database schema with Flyway.
replies.author: michael-schnell

timeline.bodyText: @michael-schnell @Sanne I'm not sure I understand the need to somehow copy the existing datasource?
timeline.author: gsmet
geoand

replies.bodyText: No, this is our own annotation: https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/master/extensions/hibernate-orm/runtime/src/main/java/io/quarkus/hibernate/orm/PersistenceUnit.java#L39
replies.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: Ah OK, I thought it was the javax.persistence annotation
replies.author: geoand

replies.bodyText: I decided against it as they are quite confusing.
replies.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: And also I needed it to be a qualifier.
replies.author: gsmet
